page.title: 09CHURCHES IN BRENTWOOD
page.content: {St.Thomas the Martyr Chapel.}St Osyth's Abbey built it in 1221. Wistan Boune closed it in 1575 but the town objected and 30 women sat in there which saved it. Its surviving records date from 1694.{St Thomas the Martyr {Church}built in 1835 300m from the chapel. It was of white brick and had a square tower. In 1837 Brentwood was made a district chapelry. {St.Thomas of Canterbury}built of flint with stone dressings in 1883 over the old church. A new tower and spire were added in 1886. {St.Helen's R.C.Cathedral}originally 'The Sacred Heart of St. Helen'was opened in 1837. It became a school in 1861 and another church was built. In 1917 when Brentwood became a Catholic diocese it became a Cathedral. By 1981 it was only dedicated to St. Helen. An extension was built in 1972.
